dynamic_line: I was an acolyte, leading religious services at churches and temples. It was a nice life; free room, board, and education, though there were many religious doctrines we had to follow.

Well, in that temple, there were certian controband 'items', if you know, and one of my roommates thought it humorous to plant one in my trunk. The priest found it, and kicked me out. I never went back.
They were later ostricized after someone else pulled that same stunt on them.
I was an acolyte, leading religious services at churches and temples. It was a nice life; free room, board, and education, though there were many religious doctrines we had to follow.
I was sent there at the age of eight, when my parents died, killed by roving murauders. I first went to an orphanage, then to the church. I had nowhere else to go.

Though, after a while, the priest seemed rather, suspisious. I did some digging, and it turned out he was orchestrating the pillaging commited by those murauders, taking a share of the loot. So, in the night, I stabbed that <name_b> 26 <name_b> times with a knife. I left, and never looked back.
